channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Victoria reaches one week since stage four restrictions began while New South Wales deals with mystery cases and Queensland closes its borders.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 17 deaths, 394 new cases on Sunday, NSW and Queensland borders restricted, Australia's death toll rises to 295

item.description: Melbourne's hard lockdown
item.title: Melbourne's hard lockdown

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Gold Coast's revival gathers pace under Justin Holbrook - and it was helped by one of the most miraculous tries of the season.
item.title: Hand of Kev inspires Titans to record win over Cowboys

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: One the Berejiklian government's own agencies has blasted as inadequate the environmental assessment of the plan to raise Warragamba Dam's height, including for the failure to consider impacts from last season's bushfires.
item.title: Warragamba Dam environment plan 'not valid', government agency finds

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The Magpies pushed the Lightning late in the contest but a handful of crucial turnovers blunted their momentum in a very entertaining clash.
item.title: Magpies lose to Lightning in Super Netball thriller

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: Three men have been taken to hospital, two in a critical condition, following alleged stabbing at a sports ground in North Parramatta on Sunday.
item.title: Three stabbed in 'brutal' attack after Sydney rugby league match

item.description: The causalities include 13 dead and two missing from the last two days of heavy rainfall, the South Korean government said on Sunday.
item.title: Torrential rains kill dozens in South Korea

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: The State Emergency Service is urging Moruya residents to prepare to evacuate on Sunday afternoon as Sydney braces for a soggy Monday.
item.title: Rising floodwaters trigger evacuation warning for South Coast town

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The NSW government minister says Reserve Bank economists have unfairly blamed the planning system for leading to high Sydney apartment prices.
item.title: Stokes fires back at economists for blame game over apartment prices

item.description: Follow the scores from Sunday's two games, with the Blues taking on the Eagles and the Demons clashing with North.
item.title: Live AFL scores: West Coast v Carlton, Melbourne v North Melbourne

item.description: Former winner Jason Day has taken heart from remaining in contention despite what he described as a "poor" round at the PGA Championship in California.
item.title: 'Itâ€™s right there': Day sets stage for big PGA Championship finish

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Jarryn Geary hopes his second child is born a Queenslander as it will mean St Kilda remain in premiership contention.
item.title: Geary hoping his child is born in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: An Australian startup has urged the federal government to ensure small firms are given development deals alongside the pharmaceutical giants.
item.title: Australian startups push for bigger role in vaccine making

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Organisers of the Call of the Card are holding out hope that restrictions on corporate events will be lifted by the first Monday of November.
item.title: Restrictions on gatherings threaten Cup week tradition

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Collingwood are optimistic Isaac Quaynor could make a swift return from his horrific leg injury with the Magpies indicating the young defender could be back in a fortnight.
item.title: Quaynor and Pendlebury both back soon, say Pies

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The guard is being treated for injuries to his hand and will be tested for diseases after the incident on Sunday morning.
item.title: Corrections officer bitten by inmate at far north Queensland prison

item.description: Life has returned to normal for many New Zealanders but some worry the country may be getting complacent and not preparing well enough for any future outbreaks.
item.title: New Zealand marks 100 days free of coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Victory coaching call could be made as early as this week. Brebner now a wildcard, but Papas the favourite, Aloisi remains in the mix
item.title: Victory coaching decision may come as early as this week

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Geelong livewire Nakia Cockatoo is pressing for selection, but Cats coach Chris Scott says he's not likely to pull the trigger before Friday night's clash with Port Adelaide.
item.title: Cats to rotate squad as Cockatoo nears return

item.dc:creator: Jake Wilson
item.description: MIFF review: The Tango Of The Widower And Its Distorting Mirror
item.title: Unfinished film granted zany finish

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Despite clinching the A-League premiership, Sydney FC haven't looked like their usual selves since the restart of the season. But it's not "the end of the world" according to midfielder Luke Brattan.
item.title: 'Everyone jumps on us': Scratchy Sky Blues a victim of their own success

item.description: The luckiest Australian performers in the world now are the 13 Melburnians who joined the cast of Cats in Seoul, where musicals are still being staged.
item.title: Musical cats escaped shutdowns to get on a real stage

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Health Minister Jenny Mikakos has acknowledged mistakes were made while Victorian authorities tried to bring coronavirus cases under control, saying she was sorry if her efforts had not been enough.
item.title: 'Deeply sorry': Mikakos' mea culpa over handling of COVID-19 crisis

item.description: Pianist Stephen McIntyre's performance last week at the Melbourne Digital Concert Hall was the last recorded before pandemic restrictions hit.
item.title: Warmth and musicianship ease the strains of isolation

item.description: Firefighters said several people tried to escape from the building by jumping from the windows of the 13-story apartment tower.
item.title: Multiple residents killed in Czech Republic apartment fire

item.description: Emma-Kate Wilson considers the work of three young female artists pushing the boundaries of the meaning of contemporary art.
item.title: Trio work on edge to express cultural messages

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: A second student from Tangara School for Girls in northern Sydney has tested positive to COVID-19, closing the school for two weeks and casting uncertainty over HSC trial exams.
item.title: Tangara school to close for two weeks after second student tests positive

item.description: Taking advantage of a spell of hot weather and calm sea conditions, hundreds of people including children and pregnant women have made the dangerous 33 kilometre crossing in recent days.
item.title: British armed forces called in amid spate of migrant Channel crossings

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Mornington trainer Jason Warren was forced to withdraw his runners on Saturday after one of his staff members was identified as a close contact of a person who tested positive to COVID-19.
item.title: Horses withdrawn after COVID-19 scare in Mornington stable

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: Two games have turned Super Rugby AU on its head and given Australian fans something to be proud of.
item.title: Upsets restore pride and edge to Australian rugby

item.description: Barcelona insist they have as much chance as Bayern Munich of winning their Champions League quarter-final despite a far from convincing 3-1 win over Napoli on Saturday.
item.title: Barca back themselves against Bayern despite nervy path to quarters

item.dc:creator: Kate Rose
item.description: Victoria has recorded another 394 cases of coronavirus, the state's lowest single-day increase for 11 days.
item.title: Victoria records 394 new COVID-19 case, 17 deaths

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: A St Albans man caught walking in Melbourne's CBD at 2am is among 268 people fined in the past 24 hours for breaching restrictions.
item.title: More than 260 Victorians fined for breaching COVID-19 restrictions

item.description: Lawyers for Americans said they were barred from the secretive jailhouse proceedings in what they consider a violation of their constitutional rights to a defence.
item.title: Ex-Green Berets jailed for 20 years over failed Venezuela coup

item.description: Protests escalated into clashes between protesters and police as furious residents mourned the victims and called for the removal of what they described as "corrupt politicians".
item.title: Early elections proposed as Beirut blast protests turn violent

item.description: Almost a year on from Ben Stokes' heroic batting display to stun Australia at Headingley, Jos Buttler and Chris Woakes combined for a 139-run sixth-wicket stand.
item.title: Root hails England's mental strength after 'brilliant chase'

item.description: The week in photos from our award winning photographers and regular contributing photographers at The Age.
item.title: The Age photos of the week, August 9, 2020

item.description: With schools across America are looking to reopen, many parents are gravitating towards private schools that will be able to better cope with any new restrictions.
item.title: US school closure fears trigger rush towards the private sector

item.description: Valtteri Bottas pipped Lewis Hamilton to pole position for 70th anniversary Grand Prix with Nico Hulkenberg qualifying a stunning third for Racing Point.
item.title: Bottas pips Hamilton to pole as incredible Hulk takes third

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Brisbane's season went from bad to worse with the forward stood down for 14 days after being caught up in a police raid as the league issued another warning.
item.title: Pangai facing fine over barber shop bust as NRL begs for co-operation

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: As Victorians suffer through a harsh lockdown, the priorities between health outcomes and economic activity have become even starker.
item.title: Health versus economy trade-off isn't a solvable equation

item.description: The NBA Bubble in Disneyland is far from the happiest place on earth for the Australian star after doctors confirmed his worst fears.
item.title: Ben Simmons to leave bubble for knee surgery with playoffs approaching

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The pair, from Mackay, will face court on Sunday after allegedly ramming the cars following a police chase on Saturday.
item.title: Man and woman charged after police cars rammed in Tweed Heads

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: More than 60 firefighters have contained a factory fire in Melbourne's north that sent nearby residents scrambling from their beds with a series of loud bangs.
item.title: Factory fire in Melbourne's north, blasts wake nearby residents

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: The former transport minister wants his new 4BC Drive gig to be fast and fun, but he says he won't baulk at grilling MPs of all persuasions.
item.title: Scott Emerson goes full circle, returning to radio in 4BC career shift

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Brisbane small forward Charlie Cameron will require scans on a hyper-extended knee, hurt on a night the Western Bulldogs were again exposed as "immature".
item.title: Bulldogs 'immature' as Lions sweat on Cameron scans

item.description: After talks with the Democrats broke down, President Donald Trump signed a number of executive orders to provide payouts for cash-strapped Americans.
item.title: Trump bypasses Congress, signs controversial executive orders

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Much of coastal NSW from the south of Sydney to the Victorian border will face the wrath of a complex low-pressure system that will bring heavy rain, hazardous surf and even flash flooding in places.
item.title: Multiple lows to bring damaging winds, heavy rain and hazardous surf

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The family of two-year-old Isaac Oehlers say they are devastated by the boy's "sudden and tragic loss".
item.title: 'We are heartbroken': Two-year-old boy named as Australian victim of Beirut explosion

item.dc:creator: Anna Prytz
item.description: We asked school students of all ages to write us a letter describing their thoughts and feelings about the past few weeks and telling us how they are managing.
item.title: Victorian kids share their stories of school life in lockdown 2.0
